thread.title: Minister Harris in Frankfurt to advance policy and regulatory debate on financial technologies
thread.title_full: Minister Harris in Frankfurt to advance policy and regulatory debate on financial technologies

author: editorfinance
title: Minister Harris in Frankfurt to advance policy and regulatory debate on financial technologies
text:
Minister Harris in Frankfurt to advance policy and regulatory debate on financial technologies 08.09.15 

Simon Harris T.D., Minister of State at the Department of Finance, travels to Frankfurt today (08-Sept-2015) to advance the policy debate in the fast-evolving field of financial technologies, and reflecting the new regulatory environment as applies across the Eurozone in the wake of the financial crisis. 
Speaking before the event Minister Harris noted, 
“The Government’s IFS2020 Strategy* is strongly aligned with the EU’s agenda for jobs and growth. A dynamic, innovative and well-regulated Financial Services sector is vital to sustainable economic growth and job creation in Ireland and across the EU. 
As Ireland’s economy continues to recover and grow, today’s seminar is timely in its aims to bring together diverse perspectives on the challenges and opportunities arising from the disruption inherent to the rapid pace of innovation of financial technologies.” 
This seminar, hosted by the Irish Embassy in Germany and organised in cooperation with IDA Ireland, Enterprise Ireland, and the Banking & Payments Federation of Ireland (BPFI), brings expert speakers from the Central Bank of Ireland and the European Central Bank together with an audience drawn from policy, regulatory, industry and academic circles. 
Minister Harris will also open the BPFI’s new Frankfurt Office.
